module.name: idea
module.short: The IDEA unit provides IDEA encryption support

descr.p: Besides some low level IDEA encryption routines, the IDEA unit also offers 2 streams which offer on-the-fly encryption or decryption: there are 2 stream objects: A write-only encryption stream which encrypts anything that is written to it, and a decryption stream which decrypts anything that is read from it.

element.name: TIDEAKey
element.short: Type for holding a user IDEA key
element.descr: The IDEA key should be filled by the user with some random data (say, a passphrase). This key is used to generate the actual encryption/decryption keys.

element.name: TIdeaCryptKey
element.short: Type for holding an encryption/decryption IDEA key.
element.descr: The actual encryption or decryption key for IDEA is 64-bit long. This type is used to hold such a key. It can be generated with the or algorithms depending on whether an encryption or decryption key is needed.

element.name: TIdeaCryptData
element.short: Buffer type to hold encryption data.
element.descr: TIdeaCryptData is an internal type, defined to hold data for encryption/decryption.

element.name: EnKeyIdea
element.short: Create an IDEA encryption key from a user key.
element.descr: EnKeyIdea creates an IDEA encryption key from user-supplied data in UserKey. The Encryption key is stored in z.

element.name: EnKeyIdea.UserKey
element.short: User-supplied data to generate key from

element.name: DeKeyIdea
element.short: Create a decryption key from an encryption key.
element.descr: DeKeyIdea creates a decryption key based on the encryption key z. The decryption key is returned in dk. Note that only a decryption key generated from the encryption key that was used to encrypt the data can be used to decrypt the data.

element.name: CipherIdea
element.descr: CipherIdea encrypts or decrypts a buffer with data (Input) using key z. The resulting encrypted or decrypted data is returned in Output.

element.name: EIDEAError
element.descr: EIDEAError is used to signal errors in the IDEA encryption decryption streams.

element.name: TIDEAStream
element.short: Ancestor stream for IDEA encryption/decryption streams.
element.descr: Do not create instances of TIDEAStream directly. It implements no useful functionality: it serves as a common ancestor of the and , and simply provides some fields that these descendent classes use when encrypting/decrypting. One of these classes should be created, depending on whether one wishes to encrypt or to decrypt.

element.name: TIDEAStream.Create
element.short: Creates a new instance of the TIDEAStream class
element.descr: Create stores the encryption/decryption key and then calls the inherited Create to store the Dest stream.

element.name: TIDEAStream.Create.Dest
element.short: Stream to write encrypted data to/read encrypted data from

element.name: TIDEAStream.Key
element.descr: Key is the key as it was passed to the constructor of the stream. It cannot be changed while data is read or written. It is the key as it is used when encrypting/decrypting.

descr.p: TIDEAEncryptStream is a stream which encrypts anything that is written to it using the IDEA mechanism, and then writes the encrypted data to the destination stream using the algorithm. It is a write-only stream: it is not possible to read data from this stream.
When creating a TIDEAEncryptStream instance, an IDEA encryption key should be passed to the constructor, as well as the stream to which encrypted data should be written.
The resulting encrypted data can be read again with a decryption stream.

element.name: TIDEAEncryptStream.Destroy
element.short: Flush data buffers and free the stream instance.

descr.p: Destroy flushes any data still remaining in the internal encryption buffer, and then calls the inherited Destroy
By default, the destination stream is not freed when the encryption stream is freed.

element.name: TIDEAEncryptStream.Read
element.descr: Read always raises an exception, because the encryption stream is write-only. To read from an encrypted stream, use the Read method of the decryption stream.
element.errors: An exception is raised when calling this method.

element.name: TIDEAEncryptStream.Write
element.short: Write bytes to the stream to be encrypted
element.descr: Write writes Count bytes from Buffer to the stream, encrypting the bytes as they are written (encryption in blocks of 8 bytes).
element.errors: If an error occurs writing to the destination stream, an error may occur.

element.name: TIDEAEncryptStream.Write.Buffer
element.short: Buffer containing data to be written

element.name: TIDEAEncryptStream.Seek
element.descr: Seek return the current position if called with 0 and soFromCurrent as arguments. With all other values, it will always raise an exception, since it is impossible to set the position on an encryption stream.
element.errors: An will be raised unless called with 0 and soFromCurrent as arguments.

element.name: TIDEAEncryptStream.Seek.Offset
element.short: Number of bytes to move stream pointer

element.name: TIDEAEncryptStream.Seek.Origin
element.short: Where to move stream pointer from

element.name: TIDEAEncryptStream.Flush
element.short: Write remaining bytes from the stream
element.descr: Flush writes the current encryption buffer to the stream. Encryption always happens in blocks of 8 bytes, so if the buffer is not completely filled at the end of the writing operations, it must be flushed. It should never be called directly, unless at the end of all writing operations. It is called automatically when the stream is destroyed.

descr.p: TIDEADecryptStream is a stream which decrypts anything that is read from it using the IDEA mechanism. It reads the encrypted data from a source stream and decrypts it using the algorithm. It is a read-only stream: it is not possible to write data to this stream.
When creating a TIDEADecryptStream instance, an IDEA decryption key should be passed to the constructor, as well as the stream from which encrypted data should be read written.
The encrypted data can be created with a encryption stream.

element.name: TIDEADeCryptStream.Read
element.short: Reads data from the stream, decrypting it as needed
element.descr: Read attempts to read Count bytes from the stream, placing them in Buffer the bytes are read from the source stream and decrypted as they are read. (bytes are read from the source stream in blocks of 8 bytes. The function returns the number of bytes actually read.
element.errors: If an error occurs when reading data from the source stream, an exception may be raised.

element.name: TIDEADeCryptStream.Read.Buffer
element.short: Buffer to place the decrypted data

element.name: TIDEADeCryptStream.Read.Count
element.short: Number of bytes that should be read from the stream.

element.name: TIDEADeCryptStream.Write
element.descr: Write always raises an exception, because the decryption stream is read-only. To write to an encryption stream, use the Write method of the decryption stream.
element.errors: An exception is raised when calling this method.

element.name: TIDEADeCryptStream.Write.Buffer
element.short: Buffer containing data to be written

element.name: TIDEADeCryptStream.Seek

descr.p: Seek will only work on a forward seek. It emulates a forward seek by reading and discarding bytes from the input stream. The TIDEADecryptStream stream tries to provide seek capabilities for the following limited number of cases:

dl.dd: If Offset is larger than the current position, then the remaining bytes are skipped by reading them from the stream and discarding them.
If Offset is zero, the current position is returned. If it is positive, then Offset bytes are skipped by reading them from the stream and discarding them.

element.errors: An exception is raised if the stream does not allow the requested seek operation.

element.name: TIDEADeCryptStream.Seek.Offset
element.short: Offset to apply to the position in the stream

element.name: TIDEADeCryptStream.Seek.Origin
element.short: Origin from where Offset should be counted.

element.name: TIDEAEncryptStream.Create
element.short: Constructor to create a new TIDEAEncryptStream instance

descr.p: Create creates a new TIDEAEncryptStream instance using the string AKey to compute the encryption key, which is then passed on to the inherited constructor . It is an easy-access function which introduces no new functionality.
The string is truncated at the maximum length of the structure, so it makes no sense to provide a string with length longer than this structure.

element.name: TIDEAEncryptStream.Create.AKey
element.short: String to use as key data.

element.name: TIDEADeCryptStream.Create
element.short: Constructor to create a new TIDEADecryptStream instance

descr.p: Create creates a new TIDEADecryptStream instance using the string AKey to compute the encryption key, which is then passed on to the inherited constructor . It is an easy-access function which introduces no new functionality.
The string is truncated at the maximum length of the structure, so it makes no sense to provide a string with length longer than this structure.

element.name: TIDEADeCryptStream.Create.AKey
element.short: String to use as the encryption key
